lexUnit.name: crumble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause (something, especially food) to crumble.

sentence.text: Charles crumbled a piece of bread self-consciously .
Bourne crumbled a bread roll on his side-plate .
He picked up the dry droppings and crumbled them in his hand .
Squeezing her fist together she crumbled it into fine powdery dust .
Squeezing her fist together she crumbled it into fine powdery dust .
Crumble the softened butter into the flour , sprinkling in the rice flour or cornflour at intervals , as and when the butter seems to be getting sticky .
With my own eyes I saw her crumble the loaf to bits and pour fresh milk on it .
Crumble the soil to the consistency of breadcrumbs .
Place in an glass serving bowl and crumble the biscuits over the sponge .
There 's no need to thaw them -- simply crumble the frozen sprigs over a dish when required .
I was in the stillroom , crumbling a pile of dried hyssop .
Rodriguez 's eyes were fixed on his plate , his short dark fingers crumbling the remains of his tortilla .
Merrill stared at him , her fingers absently crumbling a roll .
The bread sauce is certainly a mammoth task and involves an entire morning 's work , as the breadcrumbs must be crumbled by hand .
She sat crumbling a beer mat between her fingers .
She dabbed her lips with salt water again and crumbled some of the roasted chicken neck into her mouth .
She was still in love with the man , and the knowledge threatened to crumble the defences she 'd been steadfastly attempting to rebuild all day .
But mother crumbled it up and sprinkled dry salt over it instead .
If the plants are barerooted , spread the roots out in the hole , with the same proviso regarding the long ones , and then crumble soil in over them to fill the hole .
